Program a CSS selector that will style a heading 2 element with a class attribute equal to "introduction" to be bold.
Program a CSS selector that will style a paragraph element with a class attribute equal to "closing" to be italic.
Program a CSS selector that will style a paragraph element with a class attribute equal to "promote" to be underlined.
Program a CSS selector that will style all heading 2 elements so that the text they display is always lowercase, even if it's programmed with uppercase letters.

Program a CSS selector that will style a p element with a class equal to custom with the following attributes. HINT: CSS declarations should be in alphabetical order.

  • text weight should be light
  • text should be italic
  • all text should be capitalized
  • font size should be double the parent element's font size.
  • color should be hexcode: 2edb00.
  • text should be underlined
exercises.solution: p.custom { color: #2edb00; font-size: 200%; font-style: italic; font-weight: lighter; text-decoration: underline; text-transform: uppercase; }
